60fa2648-12e4-4fe2-ad5b-df0a6d9f08b5.description: The CPRC Program is created for professional coaches and others with coaching skills seeking a specialty in addiction recovery, and who want to serve a growing client base. CPRC credential holders are certified to have an understanding of the causes of addiction, addictive behavior, coaching competencies and issues specific to families in the context of recovery. CPRC Credential holders have successfully completed 14-20 Weeks of Live Practice Coaching.
60fa2648-12e4-4fe2-ad5b-df0a6d9f08b5.name: Certified Professional Recovery Coach

issuer.summary: issued by IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

entity.name: IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF Core Competencies were developed to support greater understanding about the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by ICF. ICF defines coaching as partnering with clients in a thought-provoking and creative process that inspires them to maximize their personal and professional potential.

badge_template_activities.title: The CPC program or other recognized Life Coach training is recommended but not required to enroll in the CPRC Program.

77a5fbfd-3b9c-4c38-85bf-0fb4e840ede0.description: ICARE Certified Facilitator Addiction Awareness (CFAA) training prepares individuals to lead and facilitate conversations around substance misuse, addiction, and recovery in the workplace. Certified Facilitators are empowered to deliver webinars and/or workshops that create psychological safety and raise awareness in order to heal the sickness of silence that exists within the workplace relating to substance misuse and addiction.
77a5fbfd-3b9c-4c38-85bf-0fb4e840ede0.name: Certified Facilitator of Addiction Awareness

issuer.summary: issued by IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

entity.name: IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

badge_template_activities.title: The Certified Facilitator in Addiction Awareness course is designed to equip Addiction-Aware and Recovery-Minded People through innovative prevention training to maximize their potential to become a Resource and Force Multiplier in saving lives, helping families, and strengthening businesses. Ideal for: Coaches, Counselors, Health Educators, HR, Wellness and Healthcare Professionals, and other Recovery Peers and Advocates

fcefe4d6-432d-4e6c-a0ac-adb01b0ff1e7.description: ICARE Certified Facilitator Addiction Awareness for HR (CFAA-HR) training prepares individuals to deliver an engaging business or community presentation that quickly reveals the truth about addiction. Invite participants into authentic conversation and experiential learning by breaking down the stigma and silence around addiction issues. Learn the difference between Drug Free, Recovery Friendly, and Recovery Supportive Workplaces and prepare a Workplace Plan that is ready to implement.
fcefe4d6-432d-4e6c-a0ac-adb01b0ff1e7.name: Certified Facilitator of Addiction Awareness-HR

issuer.summary: issued by IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

entity.name: IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

badge_template_activities.title: This program combines both the Certified Facilitator Addiction Awareness (CFAA) and Certified Facilitator Addiction Awareness HR (CFAA-HR) trainings into one program and is designed for HR Professionals and mid-level managers. There are no requirements to enroll.

875c39cf-8146-4db2-a53a-abc9243c016b.description: This credential certifies that students have demonstrated an understanding of the history, development and techniques of modern coaching including the use of ICF Core Competencies. CPC credential holders have had the opportunity to work through coaching tools personally, as well as successfully work with a practice client in a structured 6-week coaching practicum. The CPC may begin coaching clients in the area of general life coaching as well as develop their own areas of coaching expertise.
875c39cf-8146-4db2-a53a-abc9243c016b.name: Certified Professional Coach

issuer.summary: issued by IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

entity.name: IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

alignments.name: ICF Core Competencies
alignments.description: The ICF Core Competencies were developed to support greater understanding about the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by ICF. ICF defines coaching as partnering with clients in a thought-provoking and creative process that inspires them to maximize their personal and professional potential.

badge_template_activities.title: The Certified Professional Coach Program is Foundational and there are no pre-requisites to enroll.

00f92600-254f-43c7-86c0-bbb835e46153.description: The CCRC (Certified Corporate Recovery Coach) credential provides graduates of our CPRC (Certified Professional Recovery Coach) training program, the opportunity to demonstrate to organizations around the world that they have attained a high level of competency as a coach by displaying the ICF Core Coaching Competencies in a 30-minute recorded coaching session. *CPRC (Certified Professional Recovery Coach) credential is a pre-requisite to applying for the CCRC Program.
00f92600-254f-43c7-86c0-bbb835e46153.name: Certified Corporate Recovery Coach

issuer.summary: issued by IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

entity.name: IAPRC (International Association of Professional Recovery Coaches)

alignments.name: ICF Core Competenices
alignments.description: The ICF Core Competencies were developed to support greater understanding about the skills and approaches used within today’s coaching profession as defined by ICF. ICF defines coaching as partnering with clients in a thought-provoking and creative process that inspires them to maximize their personal and professional potential.

badge_template_activities.title: Must be a graduate of the CPRC (Certified Professional Recovery Coach) program. Must submit a video of a 30-minute coaching session along with a printed transcript and signed release waiver from coaching client. Must demonstrate proficiency in the ICF (International Coach Federation) Core Competencies.

skills.name: Develop Trust and Rapport with clients
Explore client concerns with open ended questions
Help clients in the self-discovery process
